sen.j: 屯倉（みやけ）とは、ヤマト政権の支配制度の一つ。
sen.e: Miyake is one of Yamato regime's ruling systems.
Miyake is one of Yamato regime's ruling systems.
Miyake is one of Yamato regime's ruling systems.

sen.j: 全国に設置した直轄地を表す語でもあり、のちの日本古代の地方官制の先駆けとも考えられる。
sen.e: Miyake also means directly controlled lands located across Japan, and is believed to be a predecessor of Japan's local bureaucratic system.
Miyake also means directly controlled lands located across Japan, and is believed to be a predecessor of Japan's local bureaucratic system.
sen.cmt: is believedの前の余分なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: Miyake also means directly controlled lands located across Japan, and is believed to be a predecessor of Japan's local bureaucratic system.

sen.j: 「屯倉」は『日本書紀』の表記。
sen.e: The word 'Miyake' was used in the Chronicles of Japan (the Nihonshoki).
The word 'Miyake' was used in the "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
sen.cmt: ・仕様書の例に従って、書籍名のローマ字表記と補足説明の順番を逆にしました。・クォーテーションマークが抜けていたので付しました。
sen.e: The word 'Miyake' was used in the "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).

sen.j: 『古事記』・『風土記』・木簡では「屯家」「御宅」「三宅」「三家」とも表記される。
sen.e: To describe 'Miyake in Japanese kanji, '屯家''御宅''三宅''三家' were used in the Japan's ancient historical books such as the Kojiki and the Fudoki to describe 'Miyake'.
To describe 'Miyake' in Japanese kanji, '屯家,' '御宅,' '三宅,' and '三家' were used in the Japan's ancient historical books such as the "Kojiki" and the "Fudoki" to describe 'Miyake.'
sen.cmt: ・カギ括弧は不適切ですので修正しました。・クォーテーションマークが抜けていたので付しました。・ピリオドは指示通りクォーテーションマークの中に入れました。
sen.e: To describe 'Miyake' in Japanese kanji, '屯家,' '御宅,' '三宅,' and '三家' were used in the Japan's ancient historical books such as the "Kojiki" and the "Fudoki" to describe 'Miyake.'

sen.j: ミヤケのミは敬語、ヤケは家宅のことで、ヤマト政権の直轄地経営の倉庫などを表した語である。
sen.e: Miyake's 'Mi' means honorific, and 'yake' represents 'houses', in this case the word is used to mean Yamato government's storages located in its regional domains.
Miyake's 'Mi' means honorific, and 'yake' represents 'houses;' in this case the word is used to mean Yamato government's storages located in its regional domains.
sen.cmt: ・andの前の余分なスペースを削除しました。・2文がコンマでつながっていたため、セミコロンに変更しました。
sen.e: Miyake's 'Mi' means honorific, and 'yake' represents 'houses;' in this case the word is used to mean Yamato government's storages located in its regional domains.

sen.j: それと直接経営の土地も含めて屯倉と呼ぶようになった。
sen.e: Miyake' includes lands directly managed by the Yamato government.
Miyake' includes lands directly managed by the Yamato government.
Miyake' includes lands directly managed by the Yamato government.

sen.j: 屯倉は、直接経営し課税する地区や直接経営しないが課税をする地区も含む。
sen.e: Either the Yamato government directly managed or not, it imposed taxes on all Miyakes.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Whether the Yamato government directly managed or not, it imposed taxes on all Miyakes.
sen.cmt: EitherはWhetherが適切と思われます。
sen.e: Whether the Yamato government directly managed or not, it imposed taxes on all Miyakes.

sen.j: 時代によってその性格が変遷したらしいが、詳しいことは分かっていない。
sen.e: From one era to another the characteristics of Miyake changed, but the details are not known.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: From one era to another, the characteristics of Miyake seem to have changed, but the details are not known.
sen.cmt: ・余分なスペースを削除しました。・訳漏れです（「したらしい」）
sen.e: From one era to another, the characteristics of Miyake seem to have changed, but the details are not known.

sen.j: 大化の改新で廃止された。
sen.e: Miyake was abolished at the time of the Taika Reforms.
Miyake was abolished at the time of the Taika Reforms.
Miyake was abolished at the time of the Taika Reforms.

sen.j: 管理の仕方や労働力は多様である。
sen.e: There were a variety of management methods and labor forces.
There were a variety of management methods and labor forces.
There were a variety of management methods and labor forces.

sen.j: 屯倉の経営は、古墳の発達と関係しており、概観すると5世紀を境に前期屯倉と後期屯倉に分けられる。
sen.e: The management method of Miyake progressed along with the development of tumulus, and its history is generally divided into earlier and later periods around the 5th Century A.D.
The management method of Miyake progressed along with the development of tumulus, and its history is generally divided into earlier and later periods around the 5th Century A.D.
The management method of Miyake progressed along with the development of tumulus, and its history is generally divided into earlier and later periods around the 5th Century A.D.

sen.j: 前期屯倉は、顕宗（けんぞう）・仁賢（にんけん）朝以前にできたという伝承をもつ屯倉であり、その設置地域は畿内またはその周辺部に限られている。
sen.e: Before Kenzo and Ninken dynasty, earlier Miyakes are believed to have emerged only in and around Kinai region, provinces adjacent to Kyoto and Nara.
Before Kenzo and Ninken dynasty, earlier Miyakes are believed to have emerged only in and around Kinai region, provinces adjacent to Kyoto and Nara.
Before Kenzo and Ninken dynasty, earlier Miyakes are believed to have emerged only in and around Kinai region, provinces adjacent to Kyoto and Nara.

sen.j: たとえば『記・紀』にみえる倭（やまと）・茨田（まむた）・依網（よさみ）・淡路の屯倉、『播磨国風土記』にみえる餝磨（しかま）・佐岡の屯倉、『記・紀』や『風土記』にみえる縮見（しじみ）屯倉などがある。
sen.e: For example, the Kiki refers to Miyakes in 'Yamato', 'Mamuta', 'Yosami 'and 'Awaji ', while the Harimakoku Fudoki mentions those in 'Shikama Sakoku,' and Shijimi Miyake is found in both books.

For example, the "Kiki" ("Nihonshoki" and "Kojiki") refers to Miyakes in 'Yamato,' 'Mamuta,' 'Yosami,' and 'Awaji,' while the "Harimakoku Fudoki" mentions those in 'Shikama Sakoku,' and Shijimi Miyake is found in both books.
sen.cmt: ・カギ括弧に合わせて、クォーテーションマークを付しました。・Kikiは補足説明がないと何のことかわからないため、追加しました。
sen.e: For example, the "Kiki" ("Nihonshoki" and "Kojiki") refers to Miyakes in 'Yamato,' 'Mamuta,' 'Yosami,' and 'Awaji,' while the "Harimakoku Fudoki" mentions those in 'Shikama Sakoku,' and Shijimi Miyake is found in both books.

sen.j: これらの屯倉は大王 (ヤマト王権)自らの力で開発され経営された。
sen.e: These miyakes were developed and run by the great king of the Yamato Sovereignty.
These miyakes were developed and run by the great king of the Yamato Sovereignty.
These miyakes were developed and run by the great king of the Yamato Sovereignty.

sen.j: たとえば、倭屯倉は、垂仁朝や景行朝に大王自らが設置したと『記・紀』に伝えられているもので、その地は現在の奈良県磯城郡三宅町の地を中心とした一帯であると推定されている。
sen.e: For example, the Kiki says the great kings of Suinin and Keiko dynasties were personally involved in the process of establishing Yamato miyake in the area believed to be the surrounding area of today's Miyake-cho, Shiki-gun, Nara Prefecture.

For example, the "Kiki" says the great kings of Suinin and Keiko dynasties were personally involved in the process of establishing Yamato miyake in the area believed to be the surrounding area of today's Miyake-cho, Shiki-gun, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: ・カギ括弧に合わせて、クォーテーションマークを付しました。
sen.e: For example, the "Kiki" says the great kings of Suinin and Keiko dynasties were personally involved in the process of establishing Yamato miyake in the area believed to be the surrounding area of today's Miyake-cho, Shiki-gun, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: このあたりの微高地に蔵としての屯倉を置き、周辺の低湿地を開発して田地とし、倭屯倉を造った。
sen.e: They built storages called 'miyake' on a slightly elevated area, and developed and cultivated arable lands called 'Yamato-no-miyake' in low-humidity areas.
They built storages called 'miyake' on a slightly elevated area, and developed and cultivated arable lands called 'Yamato-no-miyake' in low-humidity areas.
They built storages called 'miyake' on a slightly elevated area, and developed and cultivated arable lands called 'Yamato-no-miyake' in low-humidity areas.

sen.j: 5世紀頃であると考えられている。
sen.e: These miyakes were believed to be built around the 5th Century A.D.
These miyakes were believed to be built around the 5th Century A.D.
These miyakes were believed to be built around the 5th Century A.D.

sen.j: また、大阪市住吉区我孫子町あたりから松原市などにわたる一帯に、依網池を造成し、灌漑施設を造るなどして依網屯倉が造られた。
sen.e: They also built Yosami no Miyake in the area stretching from Abiko-cho, Sumiyoshi Ward, Osaka City to Matsubara City where they constructed Yosami no ike-Pond and irrigation facilities.
They also built Yosami no Miyake in the area stretching from Abiko-cho, Sumiyoshi Ward, Osaka City to Matsubara City where they constructed Yosami no ike-Pond and irrigation facilities.
They also built Yosami no Miyake in the area stretching from Abiko-cho, Sumiyoshi Ward, Osaka City to Matsubara City where they constructed Yosami no ike-Pond and irrigation facilities.

sen.j: また、屯倉は王室の財産であり、直接支配する土地であった。
sen.e: Miyakes were owned and directly managed by the royal family.
sen.cmt: 屯倉は,土地だけではなく倉庫や田地や耕作民も含めます。http://100.yahoo.co.jp/detail/%E5%B1%AF%E5%80%89/ このセンテンスの説明だと誤解を生むかもしれません。また、このファイルに書かれている説明の仕方だと混乱して屯倉の意味が解りにくいと思われます。
sen.e: Miyakes were owned and directly managed by the royal family.
Miyakes were owned and directly managed by the royal family.

sen.j: 仲哀朝に置かれたといわれている淡路の屯倉は、田地ではなく大王の狩猟場であった。
sen.e: Awaji no Miyake built in the Chuai Dynasty had a hunting ground instead of a farm land.
Awaji no Miyake built in the Chuai Dynasty had a hunting ground instead of a farm land.
Awaji no Miyake built in the Chuai Dynasty had a hunting ground instead of a farm land.

sen.j: 漁民や山民は直属の民として、狩猟での獲物や海産物を王室に納めた。
sen.e: Imperial subjects such as fishermen and hunters paid their customs by offering their catches to the imperial household.
Imperial subjects such as fishermen and hunters paid their customs by offering their catches to the imperial household.
Imperial subjects such as fishermen and hunters paid their customs by offering their catches to the imperial household.

sen.j: 加古川の上流三木市にあったといわれている播磨の宿見屯倉は、在地の土豪忍海部造細目を管理者として経営している。
sen.e: Shijimi no Miyake of Harima, believed to have lied along the upper Kako River (today's Miki City), was managed by Oshimumibe no Miyatsukohosome.
sen.cmt: 忍海部造細目は、「おしむみべのみやつこほそめ」と読むようです。http://www.tsuchiya.com/zenkoku/sinbun/0008.html
sen.e: Shijimi no Miyake of Harima, believed to have lied along the upper Kako River (today's Miki City), was managed by Oshimumibe no Miyatsukohosome.
Shijimi no Miyake of Harima, believed to have lied along the upper Kako River (today's Miki City), was managed by Oshimumibe no Miyatsukohosome.
